text:
Sawaddee ka welcome to hot Thai kitchen today I 
am making a dish that you can find in pretty much

any thai restaurant you go to and that is the 
classic red curry now use red curry paste in so

many videos on the show but I've never actually 
made a red curry so today's the day I am making

Gang ped gai faktong now gang ped is red 
curry gai is chicken and faktong is kabocha

squash which is our vegetable of the day let's 
get started so even though I'm using kabocha

squash today this curry works well with any kind 
of squash winter melon works really well and we

use that a lot or you can do butternut squash if 
that's what you've got available actually you can

do any kind of vegetable that you like for this 
curry it's a very versatile curry what you want

to look for when you buy these is you want to 
pick one up and it should feel heavy for its

size if you pick it up and feels light that means 
you got a lot of seeds and not a lot of flesh and

you also want to look for one that's dark green 
with an orange patch if possible because that's

a sign of ripeness and sweetness this one is 
not as ripe as it could be it's a little bit

of orange here so the great thing about this is 
you do not have to peel it but a lot of times

it'll have some woody blemishes like that so 
I'm just going to slice off that fit you could

peel it if you want to but the skin becomes 
quite tender and bite-sized chunks let's talk

curry paste now you can certainly use store-bought 
red curry paste for this but if you want to make

your own here's what you do dry tied chilies 
if you can get big ones even better because

they're not as spicy these small ones are good 
just make sure you remove the seeds to reduce

the spiciness to make the curry paste grind 
easier I'm going to blitz my Chili's in a toss

start with all the tough verbs lemongrass galangal 
cilantro roots and kaffir lime zest this is a

kaffir lime and all you do is just thinly slice 
off the skin add some friction with some white

peppercorns with some coarse salt pound away 
and if you don't have any kaffir lime zest you

can just add the leaves to the curry or you can 
just use lime zest once it is quite fine add your

ground chilies give that a quick mix our softer 
garlic and shallots finish it off with some shrimp

paste now this is a special shrimp paste that my 
friend brought for me from Thailand if you want to

make this vegetarian though you don't have to add 
it mmm and just mix it up so in other episodes I

add my curry paste after I've reduced the coconut 
milk until it's thickened the oil is broken which

you can do what you can also do is add the 
curry paste right now and reduce it together

if you don't want to make this too spicy you can 
certainly use less space but remember that the

other flavors are tied to the amount of paste as 
well which is why it's great to make your own so

you can put less chilies but then put more of the 
others if you buy store-bought paste it's going to

vary between brand to brand some are spicier some 
have more liquid so they're weaker per volume some

are very dry so it's very concentrated so it's 
really something you have to play around with and

try out the spread if you don't like it switch 
it and taste and adjust the curry paste is very

thick now and you can actually see the coconut 
oil separating from the pace that's exactly what

you're looking for however if that doesn't happen 
for you don't worry about it some coconut milk has

been processed so it doesn't separate so if it's 
very thick and has this consistency you're good to

move on okay I'm going to add my chicken so I'm 
using chicken thigh which I think tastes better

but you can certainly use breasts however you're 
going to use chicken breast you won't need to

cook it as long I cut it into about an inch and a 
half pieces get it all covered in the curry paste

and now I'm going to add the remaining liquid so 
more coconut milk some chicken stock the ratio of

chicken stock to coconut milk is actually up to 
you if you want to make this a lighter curry you

can do more chicken stock and less coconut milk 
but if you want to make this rich you can do more

coconut milk and less chicken stock so it's very 
very flexible curry going to season with some fish

sauce don't add all the fish sauce at once you 
want to taste and adjust because different curry

paste will have different level of saltiness to 
cut the saltiness and the spiciness in the curry

some palm sugar and let it simmer gently for about 
15 minutes until the chicken is for tender about

8 minutes before your chicken is done you want to 
add the squash cuz that's how long they will take

to cook now you have to be quite careful with 
these they overcook quite quickly and when they

do they become mushy and they sort of disintegrate 
into the curry which you know is not necessarily

a bad thing but it'll turn your curry into sort 
of mashed squash curry I'm going to let this go

until the squash is done and I'm going to keep 
it at a gentle simmer because if it vigorously

boils that's how you're gonna overcook the squash 
really quickly it's been about 6 minutes now I

always like to check my squash a couple minutes 
before I think it's going to be done just to be

sure because you know you never know just poke it 
with a fork and if it goes through quite easily

like this one just did it's done so actually this 
one took only six minutes seven minutes I think

that was turn it off and now taste and adjust 
seasoning mmm that's good now what does it need

it needs just a little bit of fish sauce when you 
taste and adjust curry seasoning always make sure

it's strong because you're going to pour this over 
rice and it's going to dilute your curry I'm going

to finish this off with some Thai basil and as 
an option you could also add some bell peppers

or something red so what I've got today is just 
some interesting-looking pepper I found at the

store it could really be anything red and that 
is it it's ready to go always have this with

some jasmine rice extra sauce oh that's spicy but 
it's so good the squash is nice and creamy which

works really well to balance out that spice eat 
it super tender chicken it's such an easy dish to

prepare and is such a classic so give this a try 
the recipes on how I am calm send me a photo when

you make it Facebook Twitter or Instagram and I 
with you next time for your next delicious tiny
